org.openscience.cdk.qsar.model.R
Class RModel

java.lang.Object
  org.openscience.cdk.qsar.model.R.RModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
IModel
Direct Known Subclasses:
CNNClassificationModel, CNNRegressionModel, LinearRegressionModel, PLSRegressionModel
Deprecated. 

public abstract class RModel
extends java.lang.Object
implements IModel

Base class for modeling classes that use R as the backend. This cannot be directly instantiated as its sole function is to initialize the SJava system and source R matcher/converter functions into the loaded R session. The class variable revaluator can be accessed from subclasses to make calls to the R session. Any class that builds models using R should be a subclass of this. An important feature to note when using the R backend is that the SJava initialization must be done only once in a Java thread. As a result when any model class based on RModel is instantiated the constructor for the super class (i.e., Rmodel) makes sure that SJava is not already initialized.

By default the intialization uses a temporary file which is sourced in the R session. In some cases, such as web applications, temporary files might be problematic. In this case the R backend can be initialized via strings. To do this the application should specify -DinitRFromString=true on the command line. Note that this approach will be slightly slower compared to initializsation via a temporary file.

NOTE: For the R backend to work, ensure that R is correctly installed and that SJava is also installed, using the -c option. Finally, ensure that the R_HOME environment variable points to the R installation.

Author:
Rajarshi Guha
Requires:
r-project
Belongs to CDK module:
qsar

Field Detail

revaluator

public static org.omegahat.R.Java.REvaluator revaluator
Deprecated. 
The object that performs the calls to the R engine.

interp

public static org.omegahat.R.Java.ROmegahatInterpreter interp
Deprecated. 
This object represents an instance of the R interpreter. Due to the design of R, only one interpreter can be instantiated in a given thread. That is, the underlying R engine is not thread safe. As a result care must be taken to have only one instance of the interpreter.

Constructor Detail

RModel

public RModel(java.lang.String[] args)
Deprecated. 
Initializes SJava and R with the specified command line arguments (see R documentation). This constructor will initialize the R session via a temporary file

Parameters:
args - A String[] containing the command line parameters as elements

Initializes SJava with the --vanilla, -q, --slave flags. This constructor will initialize the R session via a temporary file

Method Detail

saveModel

public static void saveModel(java.lang.String modelname,
                             java.lang.String filename)
                      throws QSARModelException
Deprecated. 
Saves a R model to disk. This function can be used to save models built in a session, and then loaded again in a different session.

Parameters:
modelname - The name of the model as returned by \code{getModelName}.
filename - The file to which the model should be saved
Throws:
QSARModelException - if the R session cannot save the model
See Also:
loadModel(java.lang.String)

getModelName

public java.lang.String getModelName()
Deprecated. 
Get the name of the model. This function returns the name of the variable that the actual model is stored in within the R session. In general this is not used for the end user. In the future this might be changed to a private method.

Returns:
A String containing the name of the R variable
See Also:
setModelName(java.lang.String)

setModelName

public void setModelName(java.lang.String newName)
Deprecated. 
Set the name of the model. Ordinarily the user does not need to call this function as each model is assigned a unique ID at instantiation. However, if a user saves a model to disk and then later loads it, the loaded model may overwrite a model in that session. In this situation, this method can be used to assign a name to the model.

Parameters:
newName - The name of the model
See Also:
getModelName(), saveModel(java.lang.String, java.lang.String), loadModel(java.lang.String)

loadModel

public abstract void loadModel(java.lang.String fileName)
                        throws QSARModelException
Deprecated. 
Abstract method to handle loading R models. This method can be used to load a previously saved R model object. Since the user can save any arbitrary R object, checks must be made that the object being returned is an instance of one of the current modeling classes.

This is best achieved by forcing each modeling class to write its own loader.

Parameters:
fileName - The file containing the R object to load
Throws:
QSARModelException - if the R session could not load the object or if the loaded model does not correspond to the class that it was loaded from
See Also:
saveModel(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

loadModel

public abstract void loadModel(java.lang.String serializedModel,
                               java.lang.String modelName)
                        throws QSARModelException
Deprecated. 
Abstract method to handle loading R models that were previously serialized. This method can be used to load a previously serialized R model object (usinging serialize()). Since the user can save any arbitrary R object, checks must be made that the object being returned is an instance of one of the current modeling classes. This is best achieved by forcing each modeling class to write its own loader.

In addition objects saved using serialize() do not have a name. As a result a name for the object must be specified when using this method.

Parameters:
serializedModel - A String containing the ASCII sreialized R object
modelName - The name of the model. (Within the R session, the model will be assigned to a variable of this name)
Throws:
QSARModelException - if the R session could not load the object or if the loaded model does not correspond to the class that it was loaded from
See Also:
saveModel(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)
